title: Ticket #7794: Fix documentation for accounting_group_user in submit man page
description:
The condor_submit man page currently states that accounting_group_user is ignored if accounting_group is not also specified.

I believe this is a false statement. In fact, elsewhere in the Manual we correctly show how using accounting_group_user alone without an accounting group is the way to specify a different accounting principal for the job.
remarks:
2020-Oct-07 14:49:55 by johnkn:
CODE_REVIEW not quite correct. It always sets AcctGroupUser (which the negotiator doesn't look at), and it is folded into AccountingGroup. If the submit file does not specify accounting_group, then the value of accounting_group_user is the value used for both AcctGroupUser and for AccountingGroup

2020-Oct-07 15:30:07 by tannenba:
Not sure what, if anything, I am supposed to do with the Code Review comment.

The ticket simply corrected the fact the manual falsely stated accounting_group_user is ignored if accounting_group is not specified. So the patch for this ticket just removed this false and misleading claim.

IMHO improving other aspects of documentation on what these settings do behind the scenes could/should be a different ticket....

2020-Oct-12 14:12:09 by johnkn:
No need to do anything than.
